description: Tick-borne encephalitis virus (TBEV) is a member of the genus Flavivirus, which associated with tick-borne encephalitis. TBEV has three subtypes: Western European subtype, Siberian subtype and Far Eastern subtype. The TBEV is transmitted by the bite of infected ticks. Humans may acquire infection by consumption of infected unpasteurised dairy products.
name: Tick-borne Encephalitis Virus Antibodies and Antigens
